item.title: Tempest attacks using a DVB-T stick
item.description: SDR The Wiki defines SDR as:1 Software-defined radio (SDR) is a radio communication system where components that have been traditionally implemented in hardware (e.g. mixers, filters, amplifiers, modulators/demodulators, detectors, etc.) are instead implemented by means of software on a personal computer or embedded system. An ideal SDR receiver consists of an antenna, ADC2 attached to that antenna, a DSP3 which reads the output of the converter and some software which processes the output based on the users’ need.
